company to fund

the rate impact of the proposed sgr is a
decrease of three cents for a

next is discussion and possible action
regarding the proposed order in docket
number 2022 un-103 entergy mississippi
notice of a routine change
in the standard rate for purchases
by entergy mississippi llc of electric
energy and qualifying cogeneration and
small power production facilities with
design capacity of 100 kilowatts or less
mr mayberry thank you mr chairman
commissioners on august 8th energy
misses to be filed for approval to
change the standard rates applying to
the qualifying
cogeneration and small power production
facilities also known as qf-21
filing was established by the commission
rule in 1983 pursuant to
the public utilities regulatory policies
action of 1978 or perpa
prior to adoption of revised rule 29 eml
submitted scheduled qf every two years
and the avoided cost calculations were
based on the projected 24 that projected
24 month period
eml now updates scheduled qf annually
and utilizes the aurora production model
corresponding to the 12-month period in
which schedule qf is to be effective
rule
29.107.2 directed all regulated
utilities
to include as an appendix to their
annual energy delivery plan the avoided
the annual avoided cost calculations
utilized in the mississippi renewable
energy net metering rule
eml's nem avoided cost filing is updated
based on the currently effective qf to
conform with the revised rule 29
eml will begin this updated schedule qf
every year instead of every 24 months
several key assumptions are made in the
calculation of the avoided cost rates
inclu including fuel prices unit
operating characteristics heat rates
capacities and outage rates
emission cost transmission topology and
load forecast
the all hours price proposed in
scheduled qf-21 was calculated by
averaging the estimated lnp locational
marginal price and miso
avoided costs for all hours for the 24
month period august 2022 through july
the peak hours price was calculated by
averaging the lmp avoided cost for hours
7 a.m through 11 p.m monday through
saturday
off-peak price was calculated by
averaging prices from all non-peak hours
for that time period to approximate the
effective dates of the proposed qf-21
rates
additionally these calculated avoided
cost rates are used as the basis for
determining the amounts paid by the
company to its net metering customers
the qf-21 rate is
up from two point nine eight three cents
which is an increase of point three five
cents
